p: The high content of linoleic acid in the tested oil suggests its high pro-health value. Linoleic acid is a polyunsaturated fatty acid belonging to the omega-6 group. It takes part in the biosynthesis of physiologically important compounds such as prostaglandins, leukotrienes, and thromboxane and is a component of lipids found in cell membranes. For this reason, supplementation thereof in the diet is necessary for the proper functioning of the human organism [ 29].
